content: @Christian Merten, @Anne Baanen, one thing I don't understand here is why we are removing the use of Bundled in apparently unrelated concrete categories, e.g. BoolRing. Could you explain that to me?

Because in this example, the deriving instance LargeCategory for BoolRing failed with

default handlers have not been implemented yet, class: 'CategoryTheory.LargeCategory' types: [BoolRing]

after the changes to Algebra.Category.Basic. Instead of spending time on investigating what is going wrong, I decided to also adopt the same design for these categories, as it seemed to me that we eventually want to adopt the Hom structure design for all concrete categories.
If I remember correctly, the same issue appeared in HopfAlgebraCat and BialgebraCat.
